alert.note: Alert for Northern Blaine County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 10 at 8:20AM MST until January 12 at 5:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 5 AM MST FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...Northern Blaine County. * WHEN...From noon today to 5 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Frostbite and hypothermia are possible if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow accumulations are expected throughout the day today; however, the most impactful snow is expected to remain southwest of the US Hwy 2 corridor across Northern Blaine County. Additional snowfall is then expected from Thursday through Friday, which may require winter weather statements.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
